alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 3:48PM MDT until August 26 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Capitol Reef National Park, including Capitol Gorge, Burro Wash, and Sheets Gulch. Up to 0.5 inches of rain has fallen. Capitol Reef National Park rangers reported flash flooding occurring in Capitol Gorge and Grand Wash. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyons. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
